Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Three alabaster discs
Description: These are three slightly yellowed alabaster discs with a slightly convex shape, a diametre that varies from 2,5 to 2,75 cm and a regular thickness of about 0,2 cm. These three objects could have been the faces of game pieces or elements of earrings or even a labret. These alabaster discs could also have been elements placed at the extremities of the grooved cylinder L 734 (a) found in the same vase.
